title: Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate-5-11-2009 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




May 11, 2009

 



Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate-5-11-2009




 THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary  _______________________________________________  For Immediate Release                         May 11, 2009 NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE:  J. Randolph Babbitt, of Virginia, to be Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration for the term of five years, vice Marion C. Blakey, term expired. Lorelei Boylan, of New York, to be Administrator of the Wage and Hour Division, Department of Labor, vice Paul DeCamp. Jamie Michael Morin, of Michigan, to be an Assistant Secretary of the Air Force, vice John H. Gibson, resigned. Stephen Woolman Preston, of the District of Columbia, to be General Counsel of the Central Intelligence Agency, vice Scott W. Muller, resigned.
